result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Bronson

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): B.A.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Mosinee P.D.).   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Nikki. 
Case Called: 3:17pm.
State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck. Defendant appears in person, pro se.
VCRW.
Reading Waived. Reserve Jurisdiction.
Court questions defendant re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel.
PLEA: NOT GUILTY by COURT.

COURT ORDERS BOND:
COURT converts $150 cash posted to $150 signature bond.

CONDITIONS:
-No contact with victim(s): B.A.B. or residence
-Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence (Mosinee PD).
-Prints and photograph.

DATES:
PTC w/JA: 5/31 @9:55am. 
JPTC: 7/18 @2:20pm. 

Adjourned: 3:21pm.
